meanings.definition: Cause extreme fear or anxiety to.
meanings.sent1: The loud thunderstorm was terrorising the scared puppy.
meanings.sent2: The horror movie was terrorising the audience with its frightening scenes.
meanings.sent3: The prankster thought it would be funny to startle his friend by terrorising him with a fake spider.
meanings.sent4: The haunted house was so realistic that it felt like it was actually terrorising the visitors.
meanings.sent5: The eerie silence in the dark forest was terrorising, making every rustle of leaves sound like a monster approaching.

meanings.definition: Engage in actions intended to instill fear or terror in others.
meanings.sent1: The villain was terrorising the town by spreading rumors of a ghost haunting the old mansion.
meanings.sent2: The masked robber was terrorising the bank customers by waving his gun around.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous kids were terrorising their classmates by jumping out and scaring them in the hallway.
meanings.sent4: The dictator was terrorising the citizens with his oppressive regime, instilling fear in every heart.
meanings.sent5: The serial killer was terrorising the city, leaving a trail of fear and panic in his wake.
